intro: Arrhenatherum rumelicum, commonly known as meadow foxtail, is a grass species native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist meadows, pastures, and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. The plant has slender, upright stems that bear spikelet clusters, which are characteristic of the Poaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and smooth, contributing to its ornamental appeal in garden settings. Arrhenatherum rumelicum is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining soil stability.
